alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Northern Dona Ana County; Sierra County Lakes; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 8:08PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero, east central Sierra and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 807 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 26 miles east of Engle to 11 miles northeast of Northrup Landing to near Tularosa. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. The winds will be well ahead of any thunderstorm activity. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and areas of blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northrup Landing, Tularosa, White Sands National Monument, Alamogordo, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base, Salinas Peak, Boles Acres and Lake Lucero. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 196 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 55 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Northern Dona Ana County; Sierra County Lakes; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
